summary: This bill, the 'Congressional Oversight to Secure Transparency of Relocations Act' (COST of Relocations Act), mandates that federal agencies conduct a benefit-cost analysis before relocating employment positions. It requires agencies to submit reports on these analyses to their Inspector General and, subsequently, to Congress.  The bill outlines the required contents of the benefit-cost analysis report, including anticipated outcomes, stakeholder assessments, a comprehensive relocation strategy, and effects on agency mission. It defines 'covered relocations' and provides exceptions and definitions related to the relocation process.
